channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Minneapolis schools cancel classes after ICE officer’s fatal shooting of woman
item.description: City remains on edge, with several protests planned in the day, after the killing of Renee Nicole Macklin Good US politics live – latest updates Autho...

item.title: French and German presidents condemn US foreign policy under Trump
item.description: In separate speeches, Emmanuel Macron and Frank-Walter Steinmeier warn rules-based international order could disintegrate Europe live – latest updates...

item.title: Tim Davie says BBC will stay on X to try to stem ‘flood’ of global misinformation
item.description: Director general says BBC needs to reach young audiences online amid pressure to leave Elon Musk-owned site The BBC’s director general, Tim Davie, has...

item.title: Trump doubles down on defending federal agent who killed Minneapolis woman as more ICE protests planned across US – live
item.description: Donald Trump repeated his claims that the ICE agent who fatally shot Renee Nicole Macklin Good acted in self-defense; DHS secretary Kristi Noem expect...

item.title: Badenoch claims forthcoming business rates U-turn for pubs ‘too little, too late’ – UK politics live
item.description: Conservative leader criticises government’s U-turn but change likely to be welcomed by pub trade Helena Horton is a Guardian environment reporter. Emm...

item.title: Who was Renee Nicole Good, the woman killed by ICE?
item.description: A mother of three and award-winning poet, Good's sudden death sparks protests across the US.

item.title: Vance criticises Denmark and Europe's handling of 'critical' Greenland
item.description: European allies of Denmark have rejected Trump's ideas to annex the semi-autonomous territory.

item.title: Brook, Boozeball and another Ashes hangover
item.description: Harry Brook's incident in New Zealand comes at the end of an Ashes tour undermined by the culture of the England team, writes Stephan Shemilt.

item.title: Fourteen clifftop homes face 'imminent' collapse
item.description: People are told their homes should not be occupied due to a risk of cliff falls caused by storms.

item.title: Business rate rises for pubs to be watered down after pressure from landlords
item.description: The hospitality industry had called for a rethink of planned changes to the way the tax based on property is calculated.
